review.title: Fuzzy Rankings: Properties and Applications
review.abstract: In practice, a ranking of objects with respect to given set of criteria is of considerable importance. However, due to lack of knowledge, information of time pressure, decision makers might not be able to provide a (crisp) ranking of objects from the top to the bottom. Instead, some objects might be ranked equally, or better than other objects only to some degree. In such cases, a generalization of crisp rankings to fuzzy rankings can be more useful. The aim of the article is to introduce the notion of a fuzzy ranking and to discuss its several properties, namely orderings, similarity and indecisiveness. The proposed approach can be used both for group decision making or multiple criteria decision making when uncertainty is involved.

sections.text: Keywords: Fuzzy ranking, similarity, permutation, uncertainty.Introduction In many areas of human activity an order of objects from 1st to nth place (among some criteria) arises naturally. These orders can indicate preferences of individuals, groups or a company on a wide range of topics, including various products, goods, meals, jobs, services, athletes, movies, leisure activities etc. in the media, rankings of the object often appear in the form of various TOP10, TOP100, etc. Ranking of the object is also important in the search for a desired object. For a certain set of keywords or key terms, users can search for books, movies, songs or Internet pages. sections.heading: 7. Conclusions
sections.text: The aim of the article was to introduce blurred rankings and some of their characteristics in relation to the arrangement of objects, a measure of similarity between two blurred rankings and their indecision. Blurred rankings are a natural generalisation of sharp rankings and can be used in situations where a decision maker is not sure about the exact ranking of particular objects. In addition, the presented approach can be used in decision-making in a group or in decision frameworks for multiple criteria, as rankings provided by a number of experts or rankings relating to specific criteria can easily be transformed into a blurred ranking that needs further analysis.
